Uses of Class
com.augursystems.armi.HostPort

  • Packages that use HostPort 
    Package Description
    com.augursystems.armi  

    • Uses of HostPort in com.augursystems.armi

      Methods in com.augursystems.armi that return HostPort 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      HostPort CallThread.getCallersHostPort()  
      static HostPort[] HostPort.parse​(java.lang.String src)
      Parses a string of the form "[host1]:[port1], [host2]:[port2], ..." into an IPv4 HostPort[]; the delimeter is any combination of comma and/or space characters; a colon separates each host and port.
      Methods in com.augursystems.armi with parameters of type HostPort 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int Armi.acceptRemoteClients​(HostPort hp, Armi.AccessControl control)
      Starts a socket server to accept remote clients; until then, this Armi instance can only be used to make calls or subscribe.
      java.io.Serializable Armi.call​(HostPort hp, java.lang.String serviceName, java.lang.String method, java.io.Serializable[] args)
      Execute a remote method, synchronously (like RMI).
      Subscription Armi.subscribe​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String flavor, Filter filter, Client client, HostPort hp)
      Subscribe to a data type/flavor published on this and/or a remote ARMI server.
